channel.title: HPCC Service Status
channel.description: We'll post information about ICER's system downtimes, updates, new features, and other information for the ICER user community here.

item.title: Winter Break Limited Coverage
item.description: There will be limited coverage while MSU observes winter break from December 20, 2025 through January 5, 2026. The system will continue to run jobs and monitored for emergency issues. Tickets will be sorted by priority on January 5 when our team returns to work after the holiday break. If you have any questions, please contact us

item.title: Research Space File System Issues
item.description: On Saturday, 12/06/2025, a brief outage occurred on the file system hosting research spaces. This outage reoccurred on Monday, 12/08/2025. To mitigate impacts to our users and their running jobs, we disabled some features on the file system at that time. Beginning Thursday, 12/11/2025, we began reenabling all file system features. Due to the work on Thursday, 12/11, periodic slowdowns and pauses on the file system have been reported. We are aware of this issue, and are actively working with our vendor to resolve these slowdowns and pauses as quickly as possible.

item.title: Slurm Database Outage at 10:00AM on 12/15/25 - RESOLVED
item.description:
RESOLVED: At 11:30AM, the Slurm database upgrade completed without issue. The database is now back online.

On Monday, December 15th, at 10:00AM, the SLURM database will go offline to undergo a major Slurm version update. The database is expected to be offline through the upcoming downtime. During this outage, the sacct client command will be unavailable for querying job information and job queue time estimations will not be updated. Other client commands (e.g. squeue, srun, sbatch, salloc) will continue to work as expected. Jobs may still be submitted and will start normally.

If you have any questions about this outage or you experience issues following this outage, please contact us.

item.title: Login Problems - RESOLVED
item.description:
RESOLVED: 11:00AM - The issue has been identified and resolved.

ICER is experiencing filesystem problems on login nodes, including OnDemand. You will experience a login that hangs with no prompt. We are working on it.

item.title: AMD24 Downtime to Fix Small Leak in Liquid Cooling Pipe - RESOLVED 12/10/2025
item.description:
UPDATE 12/10/2025 - Repairs were completed earlier than expected. Everything is back online. Please contact us if you notice anything wrong.

UPDATE 12/5/2025 - Our water cooling vendor scheduled the repairs for Wed, 12/10/2025, first thing in the morning. Jobs on AMD24 will be killed shortly after the repairs start. The repairs will take 14-18 hours, during which AMD24 will remain offline. We will continue to monitor the cooling systems closely until then.

During the repair of ICER’s liquid cooling pumps, we detected a small leak in the piping. This leak does not endanger ICER’s equipment, but we need to do an emergency repair that requires us to take the AMD24 cluster down for approximately 14 to 18 hours.

Since the repair parts are currently in transit, we do not yet have specific details about the maintenance. We have been told it will be early next week. AMD24 will need to be shut down for one to two days. We will update this blog with specifics as we gather more information.

If you have any questions, please contact us using our contact form

item.title: Water Cooling Repairs for AMD24 - Final Steps, Again - RESOLVED
item.description:
UPDATE 11/24/2025 - IPF completed the switchover and the temporary chiller is no longer being used. UPDATE 11/20/2025 - IPF is planning on completing this step between 8am-11am on Friday Nov 21. This time frame is much smaller now and we do not expect the water cooling temps to exceed any limits and not scheduling any downtime. We will monitor it closely and will only kill jobs and shut down machines as a last resort if needed.

UPDATE 11/18/2025 - Waiting on update from IPF for a new completion date. Hope to know more later today. Will likely be delayed a few days. We will give as much notice as possible, but may have to kill jobs to accommodate revised timelines.

UPDATE 11/17/2025 - IPF ran into problems and are not ready to change the diverter on Nov 18. We are canceling the maintenance reservation and jobs will continue like normal.

The final step needed to repair our water pumps from the 7/9 failure will occur Tues, Nov 18 at 7am and expected to be completed by 5pm. The primary loop will be diverted back to the main unit. During that time our main water cooling will be down for the AMD24 and Intel18 clusters. No jobs will run on the AMD24 and Intel18 clusters during this time. Jobs that will not be completed before November 18th will not begin until after maintenance is complete. For example, if you submit a four day job three days before the maintenance outage, your job will be postponed and will not begin to run until after maintenance is completed.
If you have any questions, please contact us

item.title: Update to FairShare Priority Calculation
item.description:
We have have updated scheduler parameters that determine how users’ recent cluster usage affects their FairShare priority factor. Previously, memory usage was weighted higher than CPU usage and GPU usage was not considered. Now, CPU, memory, and GPU usage are all considered in the calculation of FairShare priority and weighted in proportion to the overall availability of those resources.

More information about this change can be found in our documentation

If you have any questions about this change, please contact us

item.title: Network errors - Problems connecting to HPCC - RESOLVED
item.description:
RESOLVED: 11/10/2025 8:00AM - The malfunctioning core network infrastructure has been successfully replaced and the ICER network is 100% operational.

UPDATE: 3:00PM - We are working with ITS to install replacement network hardware to return our core network infrastructure to normal operation. Beginning at 6:30AM on Monday, November 10, we will begin bringing services back online using the new network infrastructure. Brief network interruptions may be seen during this time, but should resolve automatically without any outages.

UPDATE: 8:30AM - Impact is resolved. We identified core network hardware that had failed in a way that prevented High Availability to function properly. This hardware has been removed from production while we work to get it replaced. Users shouldn’t notice an impact, but we will be without redundancy on the core network until it is replaced. ITS is working with the vendor.

HPCC is experiencing network errors causing connection issues. We are working with ITS networking team on a solution.

item.title: HPCC Scheduled Downtime Complete
item.description:
HPCC has completed the winter maintenance. Everything should be running in full production. Fill out a ticket if you notice any problems.

The HPCC will be unavailable on Thursday, December 18th for our regularly scheduled maintenance. No jobs will run during this time. Jobs that will not be completed before December 18th will not begin until after maintenance is complete. For example, if you submit a four day job three days before the maintenance outage, your job will be postponed and will not begin to run until after maintenance is completed.

If you have any questions, please contact us
